section.p: The structure is used to capture substance use information that may be used to assess the efficacy and/or safety of therapies that look to mitigate the effects of chronic substance use, or that could be used as covariates in other efficacy and/or safety analyses. This information may be independent of planned study evaluations, or may be a key outcome (e.g., planned evaluation) of a clinical trial. In many clinical trials, detailed substance use information as provided for in the domain model above may not be required (e.g., the only information collected may be a response to the question ?Have you ever smoked tobacco??); in such cases, many of the Qualifier variables would not be submitted. This content may contain responses to questions about use of pre-specified substances as well as records of substance use collected as free text.

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="SBADM" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] doseQuantity
Information on the dosage of the substance that was consumed. [SDTM: SUDOSE, SUDOSU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
Information on when and how oftern the substance was taken. Possible values include start date, stop date, and duration. Note, only two of these need to be valued, and only two values are supported. [SDTM: SUSTDTC, SUENDTC, SUDUR, SUDOSFRQ]

SHALL contain [1..2] id
An identifier that is used to ensure the uniqueness of subject records within the substance use domain. [SDTM: SUSEQ, SUSPID] The sequence number is required.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] maxDoseQuantity
Information on the total daily dose of the substance. The structure also accommodates periods other than a day. [SDTM: SUDOSTOT] Note, this attribute can also be used if multiple total dosage amounts need to be reported.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] routeCode
The route by which the substance is administered, applied or ingested. [SDTM: SUROUTE]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode, where the @code SHALL be selected from (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 HL7ActStatus)
Used to indicate whether the activity - use of a particular substance - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: SUOCCUR]

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] consumable
Identifies and carries information for the consumable item that is being referred to.
Contains exactly one [1..1] Consumable Material (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.58)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
Used to capture textual information about the use of the substance. [SDTM: SUDOSTXT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the substance use is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] substanceUseCategory with data type substance Use Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the substance use is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] substanceUseSubCategory with data type substance Use Sub Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to indicate whether collection of data regarding an event of this type has been pre-specified, usually on a reporting form.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.66)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the substance use.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the relationship between the start of consumption of the substance use and a reference point defined for the study.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity Start Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.55)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Records the relationship between the end of consumption of the substance being used and a reference point defined for the study.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity End Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.54)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to capture information, most particularly the timing, regarding the collection of data for an event. This is relevant especially in cases where the timing and duration of an event are distinct from that of data collection.
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.59)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Used to record the study days associated with the beginning and end points of an activity that may extend over a period of time.
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Day Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)

SHALL satisfy: The efective time attribute is used to capture information regarding the start, stop, duration and frequency of use for the concommitant medication. There shall be Two SXPR components created. The first will be an interval of time stamps (IVL_TS) to addres stop and start dates. Note, when duration is included, it is associated with either the stop or the start date. That is to say, only two of the three interval parameters may be instantiated, since, with two known, the third can be derived. The second SXPR component addresses the frequency of use. It uses the periodic interval (PIVL) type. Note, that this HL7 type tends to invert the usual expression. I.e. BID is expressed as every 12 hours.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="SBADM" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood)

SHALL contain [1..2] id
An identifier that is used to ensure the uniqueness of subject records within the substance use domain. [SDTM: SUSEQ, SUSPID] The sequence number is required.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] text
Used to capture textual information about the use of the substance. [SDTM: SUDOSTXT]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] statusCode, where the @code SHALL be selected from (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 HL7ActStatus)
Used to indicate whether the activity - use of a particular substance - did occur. Use statusCode "Completed" if the use occurred. [SDTM: SUOCCUR]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime
Information on when and how oftern the substance was taken. Possible values include start date, stop date, and duration. Note, only two of these need to be valued, and only two values are supported. [SDTM: SUSTDTC, SUENDTC, SUDUR, SUDOSFRQ]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] routeCode
The route by which the substance is administered, applied or ingested. [SDTM: SUROUTE]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] doseQuantity
Information on the dosage of the substance that was consumed. [SDTM: SUDOSE, SUDOSU]

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] maxDoseQuantity
Information on the total daily dose of the substance. The structure also accommodates periods other than a day. [SDTM: SUDOSTOT] Note, this attribute can also be used if multiple total dosage amounts need to be reported.

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] consumable
Contains exactly one [1..1] Consumable Material (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.58)
Identifies and carries information for the consumable item that is being referred to.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a category the substance use is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] substanceUseCategory with data type substance Use Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Indicates a subcategory the substance use is assigned to.
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode="COMP"
This entryRelationship SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] substanceUseSubCategory with data type substance Use Sub Category

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Pre-Specified Event (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.66)
Used to indicate whether collection of data regarding an event of this type has been pre-specified, usually on a reporting form.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Non Performance Reason (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.64)
Provides a reason for not capturing information for the substance use.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity Start Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.55)
Records the relationship between the start of consumption of the substance use and a reference point defined for the study.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Activity End Timing Reference (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.54)
Records the relationship between the end of consumption of the substance being used and a reference point defined for the study.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="COMP" COMP
Contains exactly one [1..1] Data Collection (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.59)
Used to capture information, most particularly the timing, regarding the collection of data for an event. This is relevant especially in cases where the timing and duration of an event are distinct from that of data collection.

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship
Contains @typeCode="REFR" REFR
Contains exactly one [1..1] Study Day Period (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.70)
Used to record the study days associated with the beginning and end points of an activity that may extend over a period of time.

SHALL satisfy: The efective time attribute is used to capture information regarding the start, stop, duration and frequency of use for the concommitant medication. There shall be Two SXPR components created. The first will be an interval of time stamps (IVL_TS) to addres stop and start dates. Note, when duration is included, it is associated with either the stop or the start date. That is to say, only two of the three interval parameters may be instantiated, since, with two known, the third can be derived. The second SXPR component addresses the frequency of use. It uses the periodic interval (PIVL) type. Note, that this HL7 type tends to invert the usual expression. I.e. BID is expressed as every 12 hours.

classCode="SBADM" moodCode="EVN"> <templateId root="2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.23.27"/> <id root="1590124286" extension="MDHT"/> <text>Text Value</text> <statusCode code="completed"/> <effectiveTime value="20120510"/> <routeCode code="411857116"/> <doseQuantity/> <maxDoseQuantity/> <consumable> <manufacturedProduct classCode="MANU"> <manufacturedMaterial classCode="MMAT" determinerCode="KIND"/> </manufacturedProduct> </consumable> <entryRelationship typeCode="COMP"/> <entryRelationship typeCode="COMP"/> <entryRelationship> <observation/> </entryRelationship> <entryRelationship> <observation
